<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lich Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3513) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 50</row>

**Archetype** [Lich](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=179)

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

</column>

---

After years of study and careful planning, you finally completed a _soul cage_ to house your soul and successfully performed a ritual to transform yourself into a lich. Now, neither death nor time can prevent you from pursuing your studies and achieving your grand ambitions. You gain the undead trait and the [basic undead benefits](/Rules.aspx?ID=1694). Your undead craving is for knowledge.

 You gain a unique [_soul cage_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1545)—a magic item that houses your soul. Whenever you would die, your soul flees to the _soul cage_ to allow you to be rebuilt. As long as your soul cage exists, you can't truly be destroyed.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the lich archetype.

<title level="2">Lich Dedication leads to...</title>
[Bolster Soul Cage](/Feats.aspx?ID=3517), [Drain Soul Cage](/Feats.aspx?ID=3514), [Enshroud Soul Cage](/Feats.aspx?ID=3515), [Hand of the Lich](/Feats.aspx?ID=3516), [Spell Gem](/Feats.aspx?ID=3518)
name: Lich Dedication
